Name: CVE2
Description: A single-issue 2-stage pipeline embedded class of RISC-V CPUs

Name: RVB / RVP Standard Extensions support for CV32E40P core
Description: Development of light-weight RISC-V Instruction Set Architecture (ISA) extensions to improve the energy efficiency of low-bit-width mixed-precision integer arithmetic

Name: Extensions to the micro-architecture of CV32E40P core
VSRV: Simple 32-bit RISC-V Linux-Capable Core
Description: 32-bit compact RISC-V processor that runs off-the-shelf protocols under latest linux kernel

Name: CVA6
Description: A configurable family of RISC-V application/embedded cores targetting FPGA and ASIC technologies

Name: RVV coprocessor for CVA6
Description: RVV (vector) co-processor for CVA6 with support for low precision integer arithmetic (down to 8-bit vector data types) and multi-precision floating-point operations

Name: Timing Channel Protection
Description: Increasing the security features of CVA6. In particular, it provides support for timing channel protection in CVA6

Name: UVM env and testbench for the CVA6 core
Description: UVM environment for the verification of RISC-V cores, supporting a thorough verification of the CVA6 (and other) cores to reach TRL-5
Comment: Finished as the CV32A60X configuration of the CVA6 has reached TRL-5, completing the objective of the WI

Name: Compression and decompression of digital waveforms
Description: Custom instructions for CV32E40X core to improve the performance of real-time compression and decompression of digital waveforms

Name: TraceUnit
Description: Architecture and design of RISC-V Trace IP

Name: Hypervisor
Description: Hypervisor support for CVA6 complying with the RISC-V hypervisor extension specifications

Name: Riviera: RISC-V ISA Extensions for NFC Applications
Description: CV-X-IF compliant RISC-V Co-processor for a NFC Receiver decoder custom DSP acceleration

Name: SCAIE-V custom instruction interface for CVA6
Description: SCAIE-V is a portable and scalable hardware interface for easily adding custom instructions to processors ranging from microcontrollers to application-level cores

Name: TSN-TraceBus
Description: A secured transmission trace bus with message, TSN and control flow reconstruction elements

Name: GPIO
Description: A simple GPIO interface controlled via an APB bus

Name: UART 16750
Description: A UART interface controlled via an APB bus

Name: SPI Master
Description: An SPI master that is controlled via an AXI bus

Name: HPDcache
Description: An open-source High-Performance, Multi-requester, Out-of-Order L1 Data Cache for RISC-V cores and accelerators.

Name: CLIC
Description: Core Local Interrupt Controller (CLIC) is an interrupt controller for RISC-V cores with pre-emptive, low-latency, vectored, priority/level based interrupts.

Name: AXI LLC
Description: A parameterizable and runtime-configurable AXI4-compliant last-level cache (LLC)

Name: AXI
Description: AXI SystemVerilog synthesizable IP modules and verification infrastructure for high-performance on-chip communication

Name: OBI interconnect
Description: OBI Components: AHB2OBI Bridge, OBI2AHB Bridge, OBI2APB Bridge, OBI2OBI Bridge, OBI XBAR Bridge

Name: eFPGA
Description: An embedded FPGA IP to offload certain processor tasks and improve overall system performance

Name: Accelerator for post-quantum cryptography
Description: Post-Quantum Cryptographic Accelerator

Name: Low-power IO DMA
Description: A Low Power IO DMA controller with multi-bank memory access and performance enhancements

Name: Heterogeneous Cluster Interconnect (HCI)
Description: Heterogeneous Cluster Interconnect to bind special-purpose HW accelerators with general-purpose cluster cores

Name: Reduced-Precision Matrix Multiplication Engine
Description: Low-Power Floating-Point Accelerator

Name: TimeWeaver
Description: TimeWeaver is a hybrid measurement-based timing analysis tool to determine the WCET of safety-critical embedded software. As part of TRISTAN, it has been ported to include support for RISC-V processors using the TRISTAN trace IP.
Comment: Preview versions available on request (support@absint.com) as part of the first complete software package (deliverable D4.2)

Name: CompCert
Description: CompCert is a formally-verified optimizing C compiler. As part of TRISTAN, it will be extended to support the HSI (hardware-supported instrumentation) interface of the TRISTAN trace IP.

Name: Yocto for CVA6
Description: A linux image for a CVA6-based embedded processor

Name: Setting up Yocto and baremetal debug on CVA6
Description: Guidance to set up baremetal and Linux-based debug on CVA6

Name: End-to-end stack for ML software development on embedded RISC-V platforms
Description: A PyTorch-based library for implementing hardware-aware optimizations of AI models (NAS, pruning, quantization) with lightweight algorithms, and enable their subsequent compilation and deployment onto RISC-V targets.

Name: CMSIS-like Open-Source AI, DSP and compute (e.g. BLAS) libraries
Description: A set of extensions to the open-source PULP-NN library for accelerating AI workloads on RISC-V-based platforms (mainly but not limited to multi-core clusters). Extensions include kernels for fused depthwise-separable convolutions, attention layers, and N:M sparsity.

Name: COREV GCC
License: GPL-2.0, LGPL-2.1, GCC Runtime Library Exception
Description: The CORE-V GCC repository provides a fork of the GNU Compiler Collection (GCC) tailored for the CORE-V family of open-source RISC-V processor cores. It includes custom enhancements and optimizations to support CORE-V-specific architectural features and instructions. The fork provides the compiler backend support for the low-precision and mixed-precision extensions designed in TRISTAN.

Name: COREV Binutils
License: GPL-2.0, GNU Library General Public License, version 2.0
Description: The CORE-V binutils repository contains a customized version of the GNU binutils suite designed for the CORE-V family of RISC-V processor cores. It includes tools like the assembler, linker, and related utilities, enhanced to support CORE-V-specific instruction sets and architectural extensions. The fork adds the binary support required to assemble the low-precision and mixed-precision instructions in the TRISTAN extensions.

Name: ELinOS embedded Linux for RISC-V
Description: ELinOS is an Embedded Linux distribution and industrial grade Linux with the user-friendly CODEO IDE to build state-of-the-art embedded solutions in a time-saving and cost-efficient manner; also dedicated support from SYSGO is available. ELinOS has strong focus on Security with container support and services, providing drivers, connectivity stacks, real-time extensions and support for industrial hardware (e.g. since long ARM, x86, PowerPC, and, since 2024, RISC-V).
Comment: Has been released on 14 April 2024, see also press release.

Name: PikeOS CVA-6 support
Description: CVA6 is a 6-stage, single-issue, in-order CPU which implements the 64-bit RISC-V instruction set. PikeOS is a portable real-time operating system based on a separation kernel designed for the highest levels of Safety & Security. The PikeOS technology is certifiable by various certification standards including DO-178C, ECSS, EN 50128 / EN 50657, IEC 61508, and ISO 26262. We plan to support CVA-6 for PikeOS.

Name: LLVM TD from ADL
Description: Generate LLVM target description file for RV32 architectures and corresponding instruction encoding, instruction scheduling model, assembler relocation tests automatically generated from an architectural description language (ADL).
Comment: Design and verification in progress. For the CVA6 TIP implementation part of it, a pull request has been issued, but further integration with work from Uni Bologna is needed.

Name: Cloud Connector
Description: Device Client is a group of software modules that run on JamaicaAMS. It securely connects to the Cloud (aicas EDP) to get device status and configuration information, and operates the configuration and OSGi bundle lifecycle on RISC-V devices. It contains several components that were customized for this project.

Name: Device Client
Description: Cloud Connector is a software module that runs on JamaicaAMS and is used to exchange data with the cloud (customized aicas EDG) via the MQTT protocol. It is compatible with the OSGi specification and leverages the realtime capabilities of JamaicaAMS. It was newly developed by aicas for this project.

Name: RISC-V Runtime
Description: A SDK that uses the MPFR as its backend has been delivered to experiment with variable precision in applications.

Name: VxP Tools and Libraries
Description: A subset of the GNU binutils v2.34 and v2.38 has been enhanced to support encoding/decoding of the RISC-V ISA extension for VXP.

Name: Renode
Description: Simulation Framework
Comment: Used by: Tampere University, Nokia, Cargotec

Name: ETISS
Description: Extendible Translating Instruction Set Simulator

Name: SCC
Description: SystemC Components

Name: PySysC
Description: Python bindings for SystemC

Name: Core DSL
Description: Language to describe ISAs for ISS generation and HLS of RTL implementation​​

Name: DBT-RISE & DBT-RISE-RISCV
Description: Dynamic Binary Translation - Retargetable ISS Environment​​ Application of CoreDSL & DBT-RISE for RISCV​​

Name: Verilator
Description: RTL verification (simulation, formal)​ Co-simulation with Renode​​

Name: Questa Verify Property App
Description: Formal verification solutions for RISC-V (OneSpin)​​

Name: Yosys
Description: Open Synthesis Suite​​​

Name: Catapult
Description: High-Level Synthesis and verification suite​​​

Name: Kactus2
Description: IP-XACT/Kactus2 generator for the Renode simulator platform​​​
Comment: Used by: Tampere University, Nokia, Cargotec

Name: Codasip Studio
Description: Tool suite to develop/customize RISC-V IPs​​​

Name: GVSOC
Description: RISC-V Platform Simulator​

Name: Messy
Description: Multi-layer Extra-functional Simulator using SYstemC​

Name: Plinio
Description: A PyTorch-based library for implementing hardware-aware optimizations of AI models (NAS, pruning, quantization) with lightweight algorithms, and enable their subsequent compilation and deployment onto RISC-V targets.

Name: MATCH
Description: A TVM-based AI compiler for hardware-aware deployment of AI models onto heterogeneous RISC-V targets.

Name: Spike
Description: RISC-V ISA simulator​

Name: VPTOOL
Description: Graphical editor of a Design Verification Plan ​

Name: SoCDSL
Description: Automated composition and optimization of compute-intensive SoCs from abstract high-level descriptions​ ​
Comment: Used by: MINRES Technologies, Tampere University

Name: cv_dv_utils
Description: UVM verification environment for OpenHW cores

Name: Co-processor Generator Tool
Description: Tool to generate CV-X-IF compliant co-processors based on user definition of operations/instructions.

Name: SUNRISE
Description: Scalable UNified Restful Infrasructure for System Evaluation.
Comment: Used by: Bosch, Codasip, MINRES Technologies

Name: kMLeon
Description: ML-based tool for the automatic generation of extra-functional models (e.g. performance, power).

Name: uArchiFI
Description: Formal tool for analyzing the robustness of embedded systems against fault injection attacks by combining the RTL of a processor, the binary of a software, and an attacker model.

Name: k-FRP
Description: Formal tool for analyzing the robustness of HW countermeasures to secure embedded systems against fault injection attacks. Optional step within µArchiFI

Name: CV-VeriGen
Description: UVM SystemVerilog RISC-V CPU model for functional verification of custom ISA (support for CV-X-IF)
